intro: Pavonia mutisii var. hexaphylla, commonly known as the six-leaf pavonia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, pink to red bracteate flowers that bloom in summer. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in suitable climates.
